docs.snippet: New England’s defensive statistics have been downright unimpressive, but not in the all-important category of forcing turnovers....
docs.lead_paragraph: New England’s defensive statistics have been downright unimpressive, but not in the all-important category of forcing turnovers.
docs.abstract: New England Patriots lead the AFC with 41 turnovers over 16 games, with at least one in every game; team is busy preparing for upcoming playoff game against Houston Texans.

headline.main: Forcing Turnovers Is the Patriots’ Way
headline.print_headline: Forcing Turnovers Is the Patriots’ Way

docs.snippet: The Ravens’ Ray Lewis has not spoken much about his involvement in two men’s deaths, but he has advised young players, “Don’t ever take my path.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Ravens’ Ray Lewis has not spoken much about his involvement in two men’s deaths, but he has advised young players, “Don’t ever take my path.”
docs.abstract: William C Rhoden Sports of The Times column recounts personal travails of Baltimore Ravens linebacker Ray Lewis, who was implicated in a 2000 fight that claimed the lives of two young men, as he prepares with team for upcoming playoff game against Denver Broncos; holds Lewis' career, whether or not he acknowledges it, has been a testament to redemption and atonement, to making the most of a second opportunity.

headline.seo: Ray Lewis Holds Tight to Faith and a Second Chance
headline.main: A Sinner Holds Tight to Faith and a Second Chance
headline.print_headline: A Sinner Holds Tight to Faith and a Second Chance

headline.seo: Broncos’ Pass Rusher May One Day Put the Chicken Before the Sack

docs.snippet: Coach Jim Harbaugh’s stony personality has rubbed off on quarterback Colin Kaepernick. In the playoffs, Harbaugh is gambling that his penchant for winning will, too....
docs.lead_paragraph: Coach Jim Harbaugh’s stony personality has rubbed off on quarterback Colin Kaepernick. In the playoffs, Harbaugh is gambling that his penchant for winning will, too.
docs.abstract: San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick, busy preparing with team for upcoming playoff game against Green Bay Packers, has acquired much of his coach Jim Harbaugh's stony personality, remaining terse in interviews; popularity of both men, based on victories rather than personality, remains at stake during the playoffs.

headline.seo: With 49ers, Teacher’s Grade Hinges on Student’s Playoff Test
headline.main: Teacher’s Grade Hinges on Student’s Playoff Test
headline.print_headline: Teacher’s Grade Hinges on Student’s Playoff Test
